author: REDACCI√ìN CARTAGENA
title: Se fue el agua toda en Cartagena por culpa de tormenta | ElUniversal.com.co
text: En la noche de este jueves, una fuerte lluvia cay√≥ en Cartagena y, parad√≥jicamente, aunque las calles est√°n inundadas y hay caos vehicular en v√≠as como el Corredor de Carga, la ciudad no cuenta con el servicio de agua potable. Aguas de Cartagena, empresa prestadora del servicio, confirm√≥ en un comunicado que la fuerte lluvia ocasion√≥ fallas en el sistema el√©ctrico a nivel general, por lo cual tuvo que ser suspendido el suministro de agua cruda. [Lea aqu√≠: Acuacar entrega detalles del proyecto para el alcantarillado en Tierrabomba](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/cartagena/2024/07/31/acuacar-entrega-detalles-del-proyecto-para-el-alcantarillado-en-tierrabomba/) ‚ÄúA esta hora, una fuerte lluvia gener√≥ fallas en el sistema de alimentaci√≥n de energ√≠a el√©ctrica a nivel general, hay suspensi√≥n total del suministro de agua cruda, afectando el 100% del servicio de agua potable en la ciudad‚Äù. Acuacar tambi√©n confirm√≥ que, junto al proveedor de energ√≠a, es decir, Afinia, est√°n trabajando para restablecer el servicio ‚Äúlo antes posible‚Äù. ¬øCu√°ndo viene el agua en Cartagena? Se retom√≥ el bombeo, pero ser√° gradual Frente a la emergencia de este jueves, el alcalde de Cartagena, Dumek Turbay Paz, inform√≥ a trav√©s de su perfil de X que ya se arregl√≥ la falla en el sistema de energ√≠a el√©ctrica y que desde Acuacar se estaban preparando para comenzar a bombear el agua, sin embargo, el proceso para que se restablezca el servicio ser√° gradual. Publicidad El Universal conoci√≥ que el proceso para retomar el bombeo el servicio de agua en Cartagena debe hacerse de manera gradual y que, por lo tanto, tomar√° horas que se restablezca el servicio de agua potable en toda la capital de Bol√≠var. Esto quiere decir que lo m√°s probable es que el servicio se normalice en lo que resta de la noche y la madrugada de ma√±ana, viernes. Reporte de emergencias por el aguacero de este jueves en Cartagena A las 9:15 p. m., la Oficina de Prensa de la Alcald√≠a difundi√≥ un comunicado en el que se enlistan las emergencias que, hasta ese momento, hab√≠a atendido la Oficina Asesora para la Gesti√≥n del Riesgo de Desastres (OAGRD) por la intensa lluvia de este jueves. [Lea aqu√≠: Retratos de las intensas lluvias que ba√±aron a Cartagena este 1 de agosto](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/cartagena/2024/08/01/retratos-de-las-intensas-lluvias-que-banaron-a-cartagena-este-1-de-agosto/) Hay que recordar que las precipitaciones se dieron debido a la presencia y paso por el mar Caribe de la onda #25, seg√∫n el Instituto de Hidrolog√≠a, Meteorolog√≠a y Estudios Ambientales (IDEAM). Principales emergencias reportadas: - Se desbord√≥ el canal en el barrio L√≠bano, debido a la obstrucci√≥n de las aguas por exceso de basuras y escombros. - Ca√≠da de un √°rbol en el barrio Pablo Sexto, afectando redes el√©ctricas. - Inundaci√≥n en el barrio San Jos√© de los Campanos. - Emergencia en el barrio El Poz√≥n, sector La Uni√≥n, con ca√≠da de redes el√©ctricas. ‚ÄúActualmente, tenemos desplegados los Equipos de Reacci√≥n Inmediata (ERI) en puntos estrat√©gicos de la ciudad, preparados para intervenir r√°pidamente ante cualquier emergencia que pueda surgir. La OAGRD se encuentra en alerta y contin√∫a monitoreando activamente la situaci√≥n. [Le puede interesar: ¬°Pilas! Estos son los cortes de luz del 2 de agosto en Cartagena](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/cartagena/2024/08/01/pilas-estos-son-los-cortes-de-luz-del-2-de-agosto-en-cartagena/) ‚ÄúSe atender√°n todas las afectaciones y reportes recibidos para garantizar la seguridad y el bienestar de los ciudadanos. Las intervenciones comenzar√°n tan pronto como disminuya la intensidad de las precipitaciones‚Äù, concluyeron en el informe preliminar.

author: Duna M√°rquez
title: La DANA regresa a Mallorca: alerta naranja de la AEMET y aviso del Govern a la ciudadan√≠a
text:
Mallorca se encuentra en alerta naranja durante este viernes 1 de noviembre por la DANA (sigla de depresi√≥n aislada en niveles altos) que ha dejado al menos 155 de fallecidos y decenas de desaparecidos en la provincia de Valencia. El pasado lunes, Manacor vivi√≥ los efectos de este fen√≥meno meteorol√≥gico con fuertes precipitaciones que dejaron 174 litros por metro cuadrado que provocaron inundaciones, carreteras cortadas e intervenciones de los Bomberos de Mallorca, una de ellas en la Rafa Nadal Academy. Para este viernes se espera que regrese la DANA. La Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a ha activado la alerta naranja en toda la isla por precipitaciones acumuladas de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, llegando a acumularse 120 litros por metro cuadrado en algunas zonas de la isla en pocas horas. Las lluvias se mantendr√°n hasta el s√°bado 2 de noviembre, alarg√°ndose el aviso naranja hasta primera hora de la ma√±ana. Con el avance de las horas la alerta desaparecer√°, pero las precipitaciones se mantendr√°n a lo largo del d√≠a. Ante la emergencia meteorol√≥gica para este d√≠a de Tots Sants, el Govern balear ha reclamado ‚Äúm√°xima prudencia‚Äù a los ciudadanos ‚Äúlas pr√≥ximas horas y d√≠as‚Äù por la alerta naranja decretada. Se recomienda que se tomen precauciones y mantenerse informado de la predicci√≥n meteorol√≥gica m√°s actualizada. Las actividades habituales y al aire libre pueden verse alteradas. El Servicio de Emergencias 112 ha activado el √çndice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en Mallorca y Menorca. Para coordinar posibles actuaciones conjuntas, la Direcci√≥n General de Emergencias ha reunido esta ma√±ana al Grupo de Soporte T√©cnico del Plan con representantes, entre otros, de los Bomberos del Consell de Mallorca, Bomberos de Palma, Cuerpo Nacional de Polic√≠a, Guardia Civil, AEMET, Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca, Ibanat, SAMU 061, Recursos H√≠dricos y RiscBal. As√≠, ante la posibilidad de que se produzcan inundaciones como consecuencia de las intensas lluvias y dado que este viernes se celebra la festividad de Tost Sants, se han consensuado estas recomendaciones: Planificar las visitas a los cementerios en funci√≥n de las condiciones meteorol√≥gicas y extremar las precauciones, prestando especial atenci√≥n a las personas m√°s vulnerables.
 En el hogar, asegurar puertas y ventanas y quedarse en las zonas altas de la casa. Se aconseja tambi√©n retirar del exterior todo lo que pueda ser arrastrado por el agua y trasladar medicamentos, documentos y elementos de valor, as√≠ como comida y agua potable a los lugares altos de la casa.
 Se recomienda evitar los s√≥tanos o zonas bajas, como garajes, y desconectar el interruptor general de electricidad en el caso de que el agua ya haya entrado en la casa.
 En el exterior, aconsejan alejarse de torrentes y zonas inundables y, en zona urbana, buscar refugio en un edificio. No se aconseja caminar por zonas con agua en movimiento, ya que, cuanto m√°s r√°pido corre el agua, m√°s peligro hay.
 Hay que evitar los desplazamientos en coche y, si es necesario circular, se debe moderar la velocidad y aumentar la distancia de seguridad. Se tiene que hacer por autopistas, autov√≠as y carreteras principales. En caso de baja visibilidad, se debe detener el veh√≠culo y se√±alizar su posici√≥n.
 No se debe entrar en zonas inundables, aunque parezca que hay poca agua, ya que, con poca altura de agua, los coches flotan y son arrastrados f√°cilmente. Si el coche comienza a flotar y es arrastrado, hay que salir del veh√≠culo de forma inmediata y, si no se puede por la puerta, se debe hacer por la ventana. En estos casos es recomendable abandonar el veh√≠culo y dirigirse a zonas m√°s altas en caso de que el coche quede inmovilizado por el agua o que el nivel de agua ya llegue al eje.
 Aconsejan tambi√©n llevar el m√≥vil cargado y suficiente combustible en el veh√≠culo y no aparcar en puentes, aceras o desembocaduras. En caso de emergencia, hay que llamar al 112.

author: Reda√ß√£o Oeste
title: Buenos Aires sofre apag√£o e deixa 600 mil pessoas sem energia el√©trica
text:
Um grande corte de energia el√©trica atingiu mais de 600 mil usu√°rios nesta quarta-feira, 5, em Buenos Aires. O problema afetou v√°rios bairros da capital argentina. Al√©m disso, regi√µes do sub√∫rbio tamb√©m sentiram o impacto da falha de transmiss√£o.
O primeiro apag√£o aconteceu √†s 5h50, segundo noticiou o jornal Clar√≠n. √Äs 12h50 houve um novo blecaute. A situa√ß√£o gerou certo tumulto devido sobretudo √† interrup√ß√£o no funcionamento de metr√¥s e trens. V√°rios pontos da cidade registraram, do mesmo modo, o desligamento de sem√°foros, confus√£o no tr√¢nsito e mais de uma centena de pessoas retidas em elevadores.
Buenos Aires implanta opera√ß√£o especial
‚ÄúMilhares de moradores da cidade ainda est√£o sem energia el√©trica devido a um novo corte de energia. Implantamos uma opera√ß√£o especial com bombeiros, SAME, Defesa Civil, policiais e agentes de tr√¢nsito para atender nas ruas, ordenar o tr√¢nsito em cruzamentos sem sem√°foros e atender emerg√™ncias‚Äù, disse Jorge Macri, em seu relato no X.
Macri √© o chefe de governo da regi√£o metropolitana de Buenos Aires, cuja abrang√™ncia inclui munic√≠pios como Avellaneda, Hurlingham, Lan√∫s, Mor√≥n, Quilmes, San Isidro, San Miguel, entre outros. Veja no post abaixo as declara√ß√µes do dirigente pol√≠tico.
Macri acrescentou: ‚ÄúA queda de energia n√£o depende da Prefeitura, mas estamos fazendo todo o poss√≠vel para minimizar o impacto e acompanhar a popula√ß√£o neste momento dif√≠cil‚Äù.
+ Leia mais not√≠cias de Mundo na Oeste

author: Alberto G. Palomo
title: Buenas noticias para los mayores de 50 a√±os: estas son las ofertas de empleo del SEPE con sueldo superior a 4.000‚Ç¨
text:
El Servicio de Empleo P√∫blico Estatal (SEPE) ha anunciado nuevas ofertas de empleo pensadas para parados de m√°s de 50 a√±os. En muchas de ellas el contrato es indefinido , una garantiza, a priori, para la estabilidad. Los sectores son muy diversos y se valora la experiencia previa adquirida durante toda la vida laboral . Tambi√©n se observan los conocimientos que puedan aportar a la empresa.
La duraci√≥n de la jornada es completa. Tiene turnos rotativos y en determinados puestos hay opci√≥n de teletrabajo . Se incrementa la necesidad de mano de obra en el sector inmobiliario, en talleres, ingenier√≠a o personal de limpieza en oficinas y geri√°tricos. El sueldo puede superar los 4.000 euros con pago de incentivos y pluses por consecuci√≥n de objetivos.
Dichas ofertas son positivas hacia este tipo de poblaci√≥n, que no siempre tiene el acceso oportuno . Hay empresas, no obstante, que s√≠ dan cabida a los s√©niors. Muestra de ello son las que se anuncian publicando sus vacantes en la web Empl√©ate . Las oportunidades de crecimiento profesional para los mayores de 50 a√±os cada vez son m√°s numerosas.
üìä ¬øQuieres conocer la situaci√≥n de la contrataci√≥n laboral de tu municipio?
üìâ En el Bolet√≠n Anual del Mercado de trabajo elaborado por el #Observatoriodelas Ocupaciones del SEPE podr√°s consultar esos datos.
üî∑ M√°s informaci√≥n üëâ https://t.co/CrErkYqfJ4 pic.twitter.com/9PGTLp5zy6
‚Äî SEPE (@empleo_SEPE) December 27, 2023 Tal sector poblacional, antes pr√°cticamente descartado del mercado laboral, ve c√≥mo ahora existe una preocupaci√≥n desde las instituciones. De este modo, se intenta erradicar el llamado 'edadismo' en los procesos de selecci√≥n de personal y en las ofertas de empleo. Esta franja de trabajadores puede aportar nuevos conocimientos a aquellos que est√°n empezando (j√∫nior) o a los que ya cuentan con algunos a√±os de trayectoria.
Estas son las empresas que est√°n contratando talento s√©nior:
- Remax busca 2 trabajadores de m√°s de 50 a√±os especializados en el sector inmobiliario para trabajar en Molina de Segura (Murcia). Con opci√≥n de teletrabajo y sueldo de 30.000 a 50.000 euros anuales. Se valora certificado de discapacidad (33%).
- Jefe de mantenimiento de veh√≠culo industrial en Zaragoza. Sueldo de 45.000 euros.
- Ingeniero de apoyo responsable de delegaci√≥n en Cantoria (Almer√≠a), contrato indefinido, sueldo de entre 24.000 y 30.000 euros, jornada intensiva y formaci√≥n gratis a cargo de la empresa.
- Director comercial en Zaragoza, oferta perteneciente al SNE, Sistema Nacional Empleo. Se pide Grado Universitario, ingl√©s nivel C1. Con contrato indefinido a jornada completa.
- Personal de limpieza para residencia de mayores en Zaragoza, se valora experiencia previa de al menos 6 meses, sin estudios pero se tienen en cuenta los certificados de profesionalidad.
- Jefe de obra en Madrid para Eiffage, contrato temporal.
- Administrativo con certificado de discapacidad de al menos el 33% en Cantabria. No hacen falta estudios pero s√≠ se tendr√°n en cuenta los conocimientos inform√°ticos.
C√≥mo solicitar un trabajo para mayores de 50 a√±os Para aplicar a una de las ofertas de empleo para trabajadores s√©nior de m√°s de 50 a√±os habr√° que entrar en el portal laboral Empl√©ate , del SEPE. Una vez dentro, en la barra de buscador que aparece en primer lugar hay que escribir "empleo mayores 50" y darle al bot√≥n azul del lateral donde pone "Buscar".
Se abrir√° un listado completo con las vacantes disponibles a las que los s√©nior podr√°n enviar el curr√≠culum porque cuentan con el plazo de solicitud abierto. Cuando se haya elegido la que conviene, se abre un nuevo espacio con las condiciones laborales. Hay que darle a ‚ÄòInscribirme‚Äô o ‚ÄòVisitar oferta‚Äô.
 Empleo Espa√±a Mercado laboral SEPE Tendencias

author: KTM Media Center
title: Herlings counted out of home MXGP with collarbone fracture
text:
Dear Sir/Madam,Welcome to our Press Center. May we express our pleasure at the fact that you have chosen to use the pool of information regarding our company and its products and services. This information and content is made available by KTM Sportmotorcycle GmbH, Betriebsgebiet S√ºd, Stallhofner Stra√üe 3, A-5230 Mattighofen, Austria, and we are more than willing to provide you with copy, photographic and film material for your reporting about our company. However, the employment of these services is subject to the proviso that you consent to the following terms of use. The subsequent terms of use regulate the utilization of the content provided on the internet at https://press.ktm.com. Admission to the KTM Online Press Center, as well the functions and content to which it offers access, shall only take place in accordance with the aforementioned conditions. These include regulations related to data protection. Through the employment of the services and content provided, you offer confirmation of the fact that you have read and accepted the conditions. An exclusive service for media journalists Via the Press Center, you have access to our press releases and press download area. Utilization of the prepared content is free of charge. With the use of our Online Press Center, you offer an undertaking to only use the content and materials on offer for the purpose of your professional editorial and journalistic activities. Unless subject to a different agreement, basically the photographic material, data and information have been released solely for employment by journalists and press employees. Right of use and purpose Within the framework of a simple right of use, the content may only be used for the stated purpose to which the respective materials relate. As a rule, content may be downloaded free of charge and used within the scope of reporting for purposes comprised by press releases, articles in the print media, film and television reports, and publications in the online, mobile and multi-media. Additional utilization for commercial purposes of any description, or private advantage, in particular for advertising, is not permitted and expressly forbidden. Content and material may be processed and altered, as long as its clear recognition is guaranteed and no changes are made to the content that might possibly result in a meaning other than that originally intended. The content may not be used in a form that distorts its meaning and alienation of the material is not permitted. The right of use is limited to the period during which the content is available in the Press Center and in spatial terms, to the geographical area of the activities of our company. Use of the content in an objectionable or illegal context is not permitted and must desist. Transfer and duplication The transfer and/or duplication of the content to/for third parties is not allowed unless absolutely essential within the scope of the stated purpose. The electronic storage of pictorial data, data transfers and all other forms of duplication are only permitted in the course of standard production procedures and during employment that is lawful and in accordance with the intended use. You, or a third party, are forbidden to employ, store or download content as part of a service that is similar to, or replaces, that which we offer. Copyright, personal rights and legal notice All content, as well as the design itself, is protected by copyright and personal rights, registered trademark rights and other statutes in connection with intellectual property rights. All the content contained in the Press Center such as copy, photographs, videos, audio files, documents and other content offered in the system are the property of our company, its licensers or external owners, who provide content and are named in the system. When photographs, films or other images are employed, the name of our company and if existent the proven copyright notice, and/or the name of the photographer or agency are to be given. This shall also apply to electronic publications. Except in cases of premeditated and gross negligence, we accept no guarantee that the materials provided do not infringe the rights of third parties, or contravene competition regulations or other legal statutes. Provision of service and content We make every reasonable effort to ensure the constant provision of services and functions. However, we accept no liability for the availability of content, or access to the Online Press Center and its functionality. The content provided is prepared without a warranty. We exclude all guarantees of completeness, satisfactory quality and suitability of the content on offer for a certain purpose. In addition, we retain the right to alter all the content contained in the Online Press Center without prior notice. Content may contain links to other websites. We have no control over the web sites of third party providers and are not responsible for their content or any losses or damages that you may incur from the use of such third party provider websites. Data protection and data processingMy personal data filled out will be used by KTM Sportmotorcycle GmbH for the purposes of performing the functionalities of the KTM Press Center, such as, for example, the sending of information on racing series or the company. For these purposes, my data will also be transmitted to the subsidiaries of KTM AG (a list of all group companies can be viewed here) as well as to selected partners (a list can be viewed here). These data will be used, processed and stored with strict confidentiality and in harmony with Austrian and European data protection provisions. Personal data will not be marketed or sold to external companies.Registration and access Information that is employed within the scope of entry to the press mailing list or a registration for a press log-in must be made on the basis of correct and current data, correspond with the truth and be complete. If necessary, the information should be updated. (You are obliged to maintain the secrecy of the access data provided to you and to provide immediate notice in the case of its loss. The security of this user identification is your responsibility. You shall be liable for any use of the services an content on offer and all actions undertaken with your user identification until you have informed us of its loss and/or supposed improper use.) We retain the right to refuse acceptance into the press mailing list at our own discretion, to block registration to the press login and to refuse access to and/or the use of the services and content on offer. Other conditions We retain the right to alter these terms of use, or modify them to match the service, in order for example to account for changes in the legal framework or our offer. Therefore, we would request you to examine the terms of use at regular intervals. Alterations to the terms of use will be published directly on the page. At the latest, a change to the terms of use will be published on the date upon which it comes into effect and is not seen as backdated. Should individual provisions in these terms of use become invalid or contain a loophole, then the provision in question will be replaced by an effective provision that approximates most closely to the original provision. The validity of the other provisions remains unaffected. The terms of use are subject to the law of the Republic of Austria. If permitted, the seat of jurisdiction shall be Salzburg. Specimen example Should you prepare a report on the basis of the content provided, we would be very pleased if you would send us a free, specimen example of the publication to the following address or a link via e-mail. KTM Sportmotorcycle GmbHStallhofner Stra√üe 3A-5230 MattighofenAustriaMail: press@ktm.com We trust that our press service will provide your work with the best possible support and look forward to your report.
Red Bull KTM Factory Racing‚Äôs Jeffrey Herlings will not take part in the Grand Prix of the Netherlands ‚Äì round sixteen of nineteen in 2023 MXGP ‚Äì after an innocuous fall in Free Practice at Arnhem this morning led to a fracture of his right collarbone.

author: Hazel King
title: FirstMile, ACI Logistix and Sendle merge to support e-commerce shipping
text:
Australian shipping service provider Sendle has announced a three-way merger with US logistics companies FirstMile and ACI Logistix to form a new entity, FAST Group, that will support e-commerce businesses of all sizes.
Headquartered in California, with teams across the USA, Australia, Canada, India and the Philippines, FAST Group will leverage the combined knowledge, technology , infrastructure and operational experience of the three carriers. Each company will continue to operate under its established brand, all while functioning as a single, integrated and expanded logistics ecosystem.
ACI Logistix CEO Keith Somers will oversee the FAST Group as CEO, and the board will comprise representatives from all three companies.
Somers said, ‚ÄúEach of these three companies has a proud history of cultivating distinct strengths and deep insights into their respective customer needs. By combining our capabilities under FAST Group, we‚Äôre creating a complete and powerful logistics ecosystem that can support customers through their entire growth path, as they adapt and compete in an ever-evolving e-commerce landscape.
‚ÄúThis strategic merger, backed by Federation Asset Management, will bring added benefits for customers across all segments ‚Äì SMB, mid-market and enterprise ‚Äì through improved first-mile pickups, faster and complete national distribution and integrated customer support. It also presents exciting opportunities for our partners, including other carriers and technology providers, as we look to deliver more services, more innovation and more national impact.‚Äù
In related news, from September 2025, all online shops in Austria will be able to offer customers the new PostPay payment option at checkout following a successful trial by Austrian Post on its own online marketplace

author: xda-developers.com
title: At Rural Schools Conference, Rosa talks Foundation Aid
text:
By Jack Arpey New York State PUBLISHED 8:11 PM ET Dec. 05, 2024 PUBLISHED 8:11 PM EST Dec. 05, 2024 SHARE Education leaders met in Saratoga Springs Wednesday and Thursday to discuss issues impacting rural school districts as part of the Rural Schools Association of New York State‚Äôs winter conference.
It comes as lawmakers continue to digest the Rockefeller Institute‚Äôs report on the Foundation Aid formula, and rural school districts question what it could mean for them.
Betty Rosa, commissioner of the New York State Education Department, spoke with attendees about her initial feelings on the report and said that while she had hoped the department itself would conduct the study, she was pleased that the Rockefeller Institute held extensive ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù discussions with the department throughout the process.
‚ÄúI decided that I would be a part of the process, albeit technical support, and that was a welcome opportunity,‚Äù she said.
Ultimately, she said she was relieved that the end result was not a complete elimination of Save Harmless, which ensures districts don‚Äôt receive less than the year before, as the governor initially proposed in her 2025 state budget.
‚ÄúThree hundred thirty-three school districts were going to be impacted so that was an issue that I definitely had concerns about,‚Äù she said.
She also said the key to implementing any changes through the state budget process will be ensuring that opportunities for students are not negatively impacted by those changes.
While many flipped straight to the page that recommends modifying Save Harmless over a period of five years and ultimately eliminating it for some districts, Roger Catania, a member of the Board of Regents, stressed that rural school districts need to familiarize themselves with the other recommendations in the report as well.
‚ÄúDo the other aspects of these recommendations represent their needs and their interests?‚Äù he said.
The Rockefeller Institute billed the report as a ‚Äúmenu of options,‚Äù offering different solutions for various aspects of the formula and leaving lawmakers to choose which to implement. Catania said it‚Äôs important for school officials and lawmakers to recognize that mixing and matching those options could have drastically different results, especially for rural districts.
‚ÄúI think sometimes small differences, and they may be small in the minds of our budget makers in Albany, represent very large differences for these small districts,‚Äù he said.
The report‚Äôs lead architect, Robert Megna President of the Rockefeller Institute told attendees that the wide range of possibilities is by design.
‚ÄúInstead of doing just a single thing, let‚Äôs take it box by box and make a recommendation of how you might fix that box,‚Äù he said.
Jeffrey Matteson, senior deputy commissioner for education policy at the State Education Department, explained that the department will be working to examine the various impacts of potential changes so districts can react to whatever recommendations the governor and lawmakers agree to implement.
‚ÄúWe have excellent staff who know the formula very well who can take those recommendations and do some modeling so we‚Äôll have a sense of how they will interact based on each recommendation,‚Äù he said.
In a year of change, Rosa also addressed the state‚Äôs plan to eliminate Regents exams as a graduation requirement, saying she hopes people will recognize it as an opportunity to create additional opportunities to address varying student needs.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs multiple ways of looking at it, it's almost going from a single lane to a highway that has many lanes, and we want to open this up and look at it multiple ways,‚Äù she said.

author: admin
title: NWS warning for California weekend
text:
Winter Storm Warning Issued for California, Residents Urged to Avoid Travel to Sierra Nevada
The National Meteorological Service has issued a crucial warning to residents and travelers in California this weekend. Travel to and from the Sierra Nevada is strongly urged to avoid due to the expected arrival of a winter storm. The extreme weather conditions are forecast to affect a wide area, including important corridors such as Interstate 80 and Highway 50, the two main highways entering and exiting the Tahoe Basin.
The NWS emphasized the severity of the weather expected, with heavy snowfall and hazardous conditions that could make travel difficult, if not impossible. ‚ÄúTravel is strongly discouraged,‚Äù the alert stated, underscoring the importance of public safety during this time. Everyone is strongly encouraged to take precautions and closely monitor weather updates.
The forecast for the region indicates heavy snowfall, with accumulations of up to 1 to 3 feet of fresh snow, which could lead to road closures, significant delays, and dangerous conditions for motorists. In popular outdoor recreational areas such as Lake Tahoe and Yosemite National Park, extreme weather conditions are expected to impact activities such as skiing, snowboarding, and hiking. Heavy snowfall and adverse wind conditions could disrupt or even suspend these activities.
Snow accumulations are expected to be particularly high at higher elevations, with forecasts reaching up to 2 to 3 feet in areas like Yosemite National Park. The winter storm warning is in effect from 5 p.m. local time on Friday until the same time on Sunday. Residents and tourists are advised to stay aware of weather updates and follow safety recommendations issued by relevant authorities to ensure their well-being during this forecasted winter storm. Stay safe and stay informed.

author: @httweets
title: Delhi HC junks plea seeking to allow prayers at demolished mosque site
text: The Delhi high court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking to allow people to visit the graves and offer night-long prayers, at the site where the 600-year-old Akhoondji masjid, graveyard and madrassa once stood, in Mehrauli, on the occasion of Shab-E-Barat (the 15th night of the eighth month of the Islamic calendar).The court was of the view the site in question was now in possession of the Delhi Development Authority (DDA), and the relief that was being sought was like ‚Äúa mandatory injunction‚Äù.ALSO READ- ‚ÄòBabri Masjid still exists‚Äô: Asaduddin Owaisi declares in Lok Sabha‚ÄúIt is to be noted that the prayer in question as has been made in the application relates to the nature of mandatory injunction. Respondents in their status report have stated that the structure... has already been demolished and the order of status quo granted by this court is being maintained... Admittedly as of now, the site... is in the possession of the Delhi Development Authority and this court is seized with the main writ petition which is to be heard on March 7. At this stage, the court under the facts of the present case is not inclined to pass any direction. Accordingly, the application stands dismissed,‚Äù a bench of justice Purushaindra Kumar Kaurav said in the order.The court was considering a plea filed by the managing committee of the Delhi Waqf Board seeking to permit worshippers to enter the property and pay obeisance to their departed elders, during the period extending from 30 minutes before sunset on February 25 and ending 30 minutes after sunrise on February 26.ALSO READ- ‚ÄòTheir rights being violated‚Äô: PIL in SC seeks relief for protesting farmersThe Delhi high court on February 5 directed the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to maintain the status quo of the land. The court is set to hear on March 7 a petition by the managing committee of Delhi Waqf Board challenging DDA‚Äôs demolition.On Friday, the managing committee appearing through advocate Shams Khwaja submitted that locals for generations have been celebrating Shab-E-Barat at the erstwhile mosque, claiming that the razed graveyard was active. He, however, argued that the visitation would not create any right in their favor and that DDA with the assistance of law enforcement agencies has taken ‚Äúillegal and unlawful action in demolishing the 600-year-old masjid‚Äù.The Delhi Waqf Board, appearing through advocate Yoginder Handoo, submitted that since the court had directed DDA to maintain the status quo, allowing locals to enter the site would create a problem. ‚ÄúStatus quo has been granted and in the garb of this they will claim further rights,‚Äù Handoo submitted.ALSO READ- Rajeev Chandrashekhar reacts to Google Gemini's objectionable answer, ‚Äòbias‚Äô against PM ModiDDA appearing through advocate Sanjay Katyal submitted that the land was situated in the Ridge area, adding that the civic agency had reclaimed approximately 5,000 square metres by also removing Shahi Masjid, a madrasa, a graveyard, a temple near gate no. 4, an ancient Shiva temple, a Kali mandir and 77 mazaars. He also submitted that though the committee preferred an application seeking the appointment of a local commissioner, the same was rejected by the court on February 21.DDA on January 30 razed the masjid, the Behrul Uloom madrasa, and various graves, claiming they were ‚Äúunauthoried constructions‚Äù.
